raw: * @type {int} The selection mode "none". Nothing can ever be selected.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {int} The selection mode "none". Nothing can ever be selected.

raw: * @type {int} The selection mode "single". This mode only allows one selected item.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {int} The selection mode "single". This mode only allows one selected item.

raw: * @type {int} The selection mode "single interval". This mode only allows one
* continuous interval of selected items.

@type.name: @type
@type.body:
{int} The selection mode "single interval". This mode only allows one
 continuous interval of selected items.

raw: * @type {int} The selection mode "multiple interval". This mode only allows any
* selection.

@type.name: @type
@type.body:
{int} The selection mode "multiple interval". This mode only allows any
 selection.

raw: * @type {int} The selection mode "multiple interval". This mode only allows any
* selection. The difference with the previous one, is that multiple
* selection is eased. A tap on an item, toggles its selection state.
* On the other hand, MULTIPLE_INTERVAL_SELECTION does this behavior only
* when Ctrl-tapping an item.

@type.name: @type
@type.body:
{int} The selection mode "multiple interval". This mode only allows any
 selection. The difference with the previous one, is that multiple
 selection is eased. A tap on an item, toggles its selection state.
 On the other hand, MULTIPLE_INTERVAL_SELECTION does this behavior only
 when Ctrl-tapping an item.

raw: * Set the selection mode. Valid values are {@link #NO_SELECTION},
* {@link #SINGLE_SELECTION}, {@link #SINGLE_INTERVAL_SELECTION},
* {@link #MULTIPLE_INTERVAL_SELECTION} and
* {@link #MULTIPLE_INTERVAL_SELECTION_TOGGLE}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the selection mode. Valid values are {@link #NOSELECTION}, {@link #SINGLESELECTION}, {@link #SINGLEINTERVALSELECTION}, {@link #MULTIPLEINTERVALSELECTION} and {@link #MULTIPLEINTERVALSELECTION_TOGGLE}.

raw: selectionMode property modifier
* Activates / Deactivates batch mode. In batch mode, no change events will be thrown but
* will be collected instead. When batch mode is turned off again and any events have
* been collected, one event is thrown to inform the listeners.
* This method supports nested calling, i. e. batch mode can be turned more than once.
* In this case, batch mode will not end until it has been turned off once for each
* turning on.
* @param batchMode {Boolean} true to activate batch mode, false to deactivate
* @return {Boolean} true if batch mode is active, false otherwise
* @throws {Error} if batch mode is turned off once more than it has been turned on

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Activates / Deactivates batch mode. In batch mode, no change events will be thrown but will be collected instead. When batch mode is turned off again and any events have been collected, one event is thrown to inform the listeners. This method supports nested calling, i. e. batch mode can be turned more than once. In this case, batch mode will not end until it has been turned off once for each turning on.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: batchMode {Boolean} true to activate batch mode, false to deactivate
@param.description: true to activate batch mode, false to deactivate

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if batch mode is active, false otherwise
@return.description: true if batch mode is active, false otherwise

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if batch mode is turned off once more than it has been turned on
@throws.description: if batch mode is turned off once more than it has been turned on

@description.name: @description

raw: * Returns the first argument of the last call to {@link #setSelectionInterval()},
* {@link #addSelectionInterval()} or {@link #removeSelectionInterval()}.
* @return {Integer} the anchor selection index.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the first argument of the last call to {@link #setSelectionInterval()}, {@link #addSelectionInterval()} or {@link #removeSelectionInterval()}.

raw: * Sets the anchor selection index. Only use this function, if you want manipulate
* the selection manually.
* @param index {Integer} the index to set.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the anchor selection index. Only use this function, if you want manipulate the selection manually.

raw: * Returns the second argument of the last call to {@link #setSelectionInterval()},
* {@link #addSelectionInterval()} or {@link #removeSelectionInterval()}.
* @return {Integer} the lead selection index.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the second argument of the last call to {@link #setSelectionInterval()}, {@link #addSelectionInterval()} or {@link #removeSelectionInterval()}.

raw: * Sets the lead selection index. Only use this function, if you want manipulate
* the selection manually.
* @param index {Integer} the index to set.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the lead selection index. Only use this function, if you want manipulate the selection manually.

raw: * Returns an array that holds all the selected ranges of the table. Each
* entry is a map holding information about the "minIndex" and "maxIndex" of the
* selection range.
* @return {Map[]} array with all the selected ranges.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array that holds all the selected ranges of the table. Each entry is a map holding information about the "minIndex" and "maxIndex" of the selection range.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map[]} array with all the selected ranges.
@return.description: array with all the selected ranges.

raw: * Returns whether an index is selected.

raw: * Returns the selected ranges as an array. Each array element has a
* minIndex and a maxIndex property.
* @return {Map[]} the selected ranges.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the selected ranges as an array. Each array element has a minIndex and a maxIndex property.

raw: * Calls an iterator function for each selected index.
* Usage Example:
* <pre class='javascript'>
* var selectedRowData = [];
* mySelectionModel.iterateSelection(function(index) {
*   selectedRowData.push(myTableModel.getRowData(index));
*
* @param iterator {Function} the function to call for each selected index.
*          Gets the current index as parameter.
* @param object {var ? null} the object to use when calling the handler.
*          (this object will be available via "this" in the iterator)

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Calls an iterator function for each selected index. Usage Example: 

 var selectedRowData = [];
 mySelectionModel.iterateSelection(function(index) {
   selectedRowData.push(myTableModel.getRowData(index));
 });

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
iterator {Function} the function to call for each selected index.
          Gets the current index as parameter.
@param.description:
the function to call for each selected index.
          Gets the current index as parameter.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: this object will be available via "this" in the iterator

raw: * Removes an interval from the current selection.
* @param fromIndex {Integer} the first index of the interval (including).
* @param toIndex {Integer} the last index of the interval (including).
* @param rowsRemoved {Boolean?} rows were removed that caused this selection to change.
*   If rows were removed, move the selections over so the same rows are selected as before.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes an interval from the current selection.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: fromIndex {Integer} the first index of the interval (including).
@param.description: the first index of the interval (including).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: toIndex {Integer} the last index of the interval (including).
@param.description: the last index of the interval (including).

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
rowsRemoved {Boolean?} rows were removed that caused this selection to change.
   If rows were removed, move the selections over so the same rows are selected as before.
@param.description:
rows were removed that caused this selection to change.
   If rows were removed, move the selections over so the same rows are selected as before.

raw: * Fires the "changeSelection" event to all registered listeners. If the selection model
* currently is in batch mode, only one event will be thrown when batch mode is ended.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fires the "changeSelection" event to all registered listeners. If the selection model currently is in batch mode, only one event will be thrown when batch mode is ended.
